p: Both flowers and leaves of plants emit aroma compound that moved through the air and is detected by the olfactory system of animals. The complexity of aroma is still challenging because smell of any flower or plant is not due to a single chemical compound. Although plants and flowers consist of many chemical compounds, all of them do not contribute in the aroma. As the rose scent majorly influenced by major constituent compound (–) - cis-rose oxide and minor constituent compounds, namely, beta-damascenone (family – rose ketones) and beta-ionone of the plant’s essential oil, while other compounds like geraniol, nerol, (–) -citronellol, farnesol, and linalool contributions as minor.
